meanings.definition: A person or thing that indicates.
meanings.sent1: The traffic light is an indicator of when to stop and go.
meanings.sent2: The compass is a helpful indicator of which direction to go.
meanings.sent3: The barking dog was an indicator that someone was at the door.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was an indicator of her happiness.
meanings.sent5: The thermometer served as a clear indicator of the room temperature.

meanings.definition: A device providing specific information on the state or condition of something.
meanings.sent1: The fuel gauge in the car is an important indicator of how much gas is left.
meanings.sent2: The weather vane is a useful indicator of wind direction.
meanings.sent3: The blinking light on the dashboard was an indicator that the engine needed attention.
meanings.sent4: The barometer is an indicator of upcoming weather changes.
meanings.sent5: The clock on the wall is a reliable indicator of the time.

meanings.definition: A statistical value that provides insight into the state or condition of a system.
meanings.sent1: The unemployment rate is an important economic indicator.
meanings.sent2: The stock market index is a key indicator of financial health.
meanings.sent3: The number of likes on social media can be an indicator of popularity.
meanings.sent4: The crime rate serves as an indicator of safety in a neighborhood.
meanings.sent5: The test scores are a crucial indicator of student performance.
